clinical_study.brief_title: GDP in Frontline Chemotherapy for Patients With PTCL-NOS
clinical_study.official_title: The Efficacy and Toxicity of GDP Chemotherapy in Patients With Peripheral T-cell Lymphoma: An Open-label, Single-arm, Phase II Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of GDP (gemcitabine, dexamethasone, and cisplatin) chemotherapy in patients with peripheral T-cell lymphoma-NOS as frontline treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: Peripheral T-cell lymphomas,not otherwise specified constitutes 25.9% of Peripheral T-cell lymphomas and over 15% of all lymphomas by the World Health Organization classification. Because of the rare presentation and evident heterogeneity of PTCL-NOS, optimal frontline therapy for this disease in the modern era remains unclear. Patients have traditionally been treated with anthracycline-containing chemotherapy such as CHOP or CHOP-like regimen used in B-cell NHLs. This strategy is associated with an overall response rate higher than 60%, but the 5-year PFS and OS rates have been reported to be as low as approximately 20-30%.Better therapeutic regimens are in highly need to improve the survival outcome of these patients. The investigators' previous study reported an ORR of 64% in relapsed/refractory PTCL-NOS patients. Therefore, the investigators design this study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of GDP chemotherapy as frontline treatment in patients with PTCL-NOS.

secondary_outcome.measure: number of patients with adverse events

arm_group.description: GDP chemotherapy: gemcitabine (1000mg/m2 intravenously over 30 minutes on days 1 and 8), cisplatin (25mg/m2 intravenously over 60 minutes on days 1-3), and dexamethasone (20mg/d orally on days 1-4 and days 11-14), which was administered every 21 days.
